intro: Bradburya scandens, commonly known as the climbing bradburya, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often dense and evergreen, providing ornamental value in gardens. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
